Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yesterday, Angela may or may not have figured out that I'm having an affair with her husband. So I just have to wait and see. When she comes in, if she's cold and awkward and cruel to me, then great, it's business as usual.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good morning. [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar... [sighs] can I ask you a question?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispering] Of course, ask me a que- questions.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is it cool in here to you?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [hoarsely] Yes, a little bit. [normal voice] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think the thermostat is acting up again.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's the stupid thermostat! That thing is a catastrophe. So I'm gonna, um, on your suggestion, get someone to fix it. I'll just go downstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, thank you, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She doesn't know. I shouldn't be surprised. This is a woman who married a man who is obviously a homosexual. Basically, she has her head in the sand. In a way I feel sorry for her. I guess the universe rewards true love.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, well, well, it's finally happened. Pam has ceased caring.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: These are my painting clothes.I think I'm gonna do it. I am really gonna start painting the warehouse mural today. [Jim applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sure you don't want to put another coat of primer on that Pam?Queen of the primer, that one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got this, Beesley. Actually, do you want me to come down and help you get started?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you avoiding your phone call?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? Yeah, right. As if.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today I will be asking David Wallace if I can start working part-time, because the sports marketing company that I started really needs me to be there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Last week Jim wasn't there, and they named the company Athlead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I could have prevented that. So I have to talk to Wallace.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell them your opening line.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs] Hey David, how would you like a guy who's not here as much, gets paid the same amount of salary, and has bigger fish to fry in Philadelphia?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think it's good. He likes fishing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is gonna be awful.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: One of my jobs is to input customer complaints into the computer. And when they're in, I fill out one of these cards. But the information's already on the computer, so....why am I filling out the card? I asked Andy, and he told me to "chillax," and then went away on a big, long boat ride. So here we are. Don't give me a pointless office chore, because I will build a little paper house. Fight the power.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Meet me in the old place, five minutes. I need you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [upon seeing Dwight naked] Ugh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on in, the water's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, it's not that kind of meeting. Put your clothes back on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. That's not why I'm naked. I always work out without my clothes. [does jumping jacks]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Just put them on! Put on your clothes. I need your help. I need someone who can operate outside of the law. Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry, your vigilante privileges ended when you broke up with me. If I'm not in your panties, I don't go vigilantes. Why don't you ask your husband?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My marriage is in danger. I don't know who I can trust. I need someone to be there for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] All right, what are we talking? Surveillance, wire-tapping?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, the less I know, the better. I know just the guy. He was a volunteer sheriff too. Kicked off the force.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can you arrange a meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can try. I'm gonna use SMS text.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Text went through.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All we can do is sit and wait.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [phone vibrates] Oh, look at that. Yeah, he's free anytime. Not a problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, I can handle any client issues from Philly.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah, but I really need someone in the office. If there's a crisis -- the more I think about it --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you mean handle it in person. Oh, well, Phyllis and Stanley have agree to cover for me while I'm gone.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: They did?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Well, that is different. In that case, yes- Maybe this can work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why should we help you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because we're friends.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: When is my birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unfair. When's my birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know, because we're not friends.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How about this- You let me take you to lunch, and I make my case?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Now we're talkin'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Make it go taller.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: That's the idea.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, not taller this way, taller this way. [gesturing with hands]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well, I've gotta build a wider base first before I can go higher.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're not getting this, Peter. Make it go wider... up!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [entering] What are y'all doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me and Pete are building a tower.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool. It should be taller though, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Obviously. He's a sweet kid, Darryl. But he's not the sharpest guy in the drawer.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Kevin, I can hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow! Dwight! Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in the van.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: God!

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Is it safe to talk?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, this documentary crew has been following our every move for the past nine years, but I don't see them so I think we're good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So what are your credentials?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: I started following people around to get exercise. Turns out, I'm damn good at it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you have a gun?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [snickers] Does he own a gun? Show her.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: You tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: It's the receipt for my gun.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You don't carry it with you?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Read the receipt. That's a $300 gun. Someone could steal it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have any idea how many guns Trevor's had stolen from him?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Now I keep it in a safe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Good safe?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Oh, you tell me. [shows Dwight receipt]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [studying mural wall] I guess if I make a mistake, I can just paint over it with a shrub or something. It's just, I think less of paintings with a lot of shrubs. So, I'm gonna limit myself to one shrub.

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: You paint wall now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Painting now. I just want to make sure that...

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: You paint now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's probably gonna be a few minutes. So you can just go back to doing whatever you were doing.

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: I wait.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yay!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's what I'm talkin' about.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: This next card comes to us thanks to Meredith Palmer, who called Eastern Pennsylvania Seminary a, quote 'sausage factory.'

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh OOOH!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [approving cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Bang.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yep, yep, yep.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: All right. Up next we got a whole lotta Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Let's find out what I did.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You get half now and half upon completion of said job.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: And that's all off the books?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Obviously.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Nice. No taxes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, so everything you need to know about the target is in here.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: So what's the job?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Murder.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Okay, that's the big one. That's the big "M."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't have someone murdered.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What if they deserved it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did they do to you, Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They're sleeping with my husband.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, Monkey. Oh, I feel for you.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: This seems a little crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Crazy. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: But I think I'm up for it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Absolutely not. There are a lot of different ways to get revenge. I've had great success by defecating in a paper bag, put it on the porch-

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: That's very effective. I've been on the receiving end of that quite a few times. It's devastating.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no, no. It has to be physical. I want this person to suffer.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: What about a knee-capping?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! You're not helping, Trevor!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, a knee-capping could work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Angela! What are you saying?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You said you would be there for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm trying, but what you're asking is-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's the only thing that will make this right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. But it's cruel, because a woman with damaged knees can't scrub worth a damn.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: All right, then it's settled. One knee-capping. Now, the hit goes down at 4:00. Keep in mind, once I leave, there's no turning back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, truth be told, I think all you'll really be doing is accepting calls from my clients while I'm gone.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We've got all afternoon to talk about that.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Morning, folks.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'll have the surf and turf with a side order of lobster.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Actually, the surf and turf does come with lob-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not enough lobster. Side order.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How much wine do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I brought you a cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks, Oscar. You're such an angel.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [talking into phone] I just gave her a cookie, and she called me an angel, so... yeah, we're good. Yeah. [exhales] We dodged a bullet, yes. Okay. Yeah. Yeah, yeah- Well, I gotta go now, but- Okay, bye. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: There we go.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Nicely done. Very nicely done. All right, this next one goes to Darryl for pocket dialing a customer while having sex.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oooohh... you salty dog.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, what can I say, a player's gotta play.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, that was the sound of me eating spaghetti. But I'm gonna let them think the other thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, I got this one.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, be careful! Be careful! Be careful

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, I got it. Easy does it, everyone. Nobody even take a breath.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [shouting as tower collapses] Oh no! Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What did I just say? What did I just say?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey, it's just a mistake. Just a mistake. That's what this tower's all about -- mistakes. Okay, if you're afraid of screwing up, the tower's not for you. Show of hands -- who here has never had a complaint? That's right. Nobody. See that? Nobody. Okay? Let's get back to work, huh? Come on, you in?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: There we go. All right, let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, at the end of the day, it's really only two days. I mean, I'll be back in the office. If you need me for an emergency, call me. I'll be there...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know what? I don't know where the years went. 'Cause sometimes when I look at my hands, I don't even recognize them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tell me about it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Whose hands are these? [holding out her hands to Jim] Theyre not my hands. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. You know what? Maybe we'll just... We'll go slow.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No. Jim... [wine bottle clangs on plate]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: All right. Check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Like a Phoenix from the ashes. Ksshhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice. Pretty soon, we're gonna be at the ceiling.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Can you hand me a card?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um,. it's empty.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. We could use a blank card.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: No!!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That's cheating.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I could get us a complaint.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You? Little Miss Priss? You wouldn't fart on a butterfly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I wouldn't. I can't even relate to that impulse. But I bet I could get us a customer complaint. I'd like to try.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hmm. Yeah. All right! Yea, go, Pam! Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [chanting] "Pam!"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What? Why did you call me out here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The target- it's Oscar, isn't it? He and the senator are gaying each other.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your nostrils tell a different story. They flare like that every time you're engaging in deception. Hello again, naughty nostrils.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine! It's Oscar. So what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I could understand you wanting to get a stranger's knees whacked. But a co-worker- Dare I say, a friend?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Exactly, a friend. Someone who sits next to you year after year, making chitchat and smiling, and all the while running behind your back and defiling your marriage and seducing your husband.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't even imagine how painful this must be for you. But the first ones to break your marriage vows were you and me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, you might be right. But it's too late now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! No, no! [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar? Oscar. Oscar, good. Hey come with me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come -- come with me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There are a bunch of construction workers in the warehouse without their trousers, drinking diet sodas. You have got to see this. They're extraordinary.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yahtzee.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Sandwich delivery for Mr. Oscar Martinez.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I am Oscar Martinez.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, not him, not him. Outside. Outside.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wha- wh-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know, there's doughnuts in the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice! Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, I was really wondering if maybe we could lock this down before lunch is over.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Don't be pushy Jim. It's tacky.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Phyllis! Phyllis, that's- that's decorative.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, there's wine in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Still decorative.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is it white wine?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to customer] Can you help me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't- don't- don't pole people with knives.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [groaning while trying to open giant wine bottle] ha ha!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis! Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ooh, bring it over.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's no time to explain. [descending stairs] Okay, actually, there is time to explain. When Angela found out that you seduced her husband, we hired a guy to break your knee caps.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! What is wrong wiht you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you? There are a million gorgeous guys in the Scranton Wilkes-Barre area, and you choose the man who's the father of her child?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, don't lie. I'm trying to save those precious knees you're always bragging about. Now, let's get out of here. He could be right behind us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aah! Actually, he's right in front of us.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Let's get it on. I'm gonna do this. I might- I might puke, but I'm gonna do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Trevor, I am not gonna let you. He's a Dunder-Mifflin man. He's my tribe.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Dwight, but for once in my stupid, stupid life, I'm gonna follow through on something, all right? I have masculinity issues- Stop! No!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Disarm!

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: You don't- [all three grunting]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't move. And disarm now! [Oscar gets weapon away from others]

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! No, Oscar. He's a friend. He's a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, the client is Heymont Brake and Tire. They're family-owned, but don't let that take away from your edge!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Come on, Pam, I know you can fail. I see failure in you.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Remember, you're a scumbag, so you think scummy thoughts. Like this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [into phone] Hello, this is Pam Halpert. I'm calling from Dunder-Mifflin. Yes, your paper provider. And I just called to say... your mama is so fat, when she wears red, people yell, "Hey, kool-aid." Yeah, your mama's fat. This is Pam Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Did she buy it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Basically I couldn't tell, but I think...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Were they angry?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I- I thought they were confused at least...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Erin. Yes, you can. Okay. I will make sure that goes on file. [hangs up] Ladies and gentlemen, we just lost a client!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice. Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You did good. You did good.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: See ya later, Heymont.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: If you chase me, I will run so fast. If you catch me I will bite so hard. Got it? Good-bye, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What the hell, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: See ya later, Trevor.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: you are incorrigible!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just saved your life. You're welcome!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You hired someone to hit me with a pipe!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You deserved every bit of it! You made my husband gay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What- what I did was wrong, and I have to live with that every day. But your husband is... gay. He was gay when you married him!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, until you face that, you're gonna be confused and angry for all the wrong reasons. But if you want to blame me for the whole thing, go ahead -- I won't stop you. Hit me. you have my blessing. Hit me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well are you gonna let go of it? Because part of the blame is definitely on you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, it's a lead freaking pipe.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: God! [kicks Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Aah!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You were supposed to be my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry. Angela-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Our crowning complaint card comes to us thanks to Pamela Halpert...

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: For insulting a client's recently deceased mother.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did not know that.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well, a woman who struggled with obesity all her life.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: yeah. That's- that is terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [cheers and applause as Pete puts last card on tower]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You did it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I feel so stupid. I sit next to him every day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not stupid. Jazz is stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [crying] Jazz is stupid! I mean, just play the right notes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. You're gonna be okay, Monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't like your friend Trevor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't like him either. And yet I really like him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, we're here. Perfect. [covers sleeping Phyllis with his jacket]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're gonna cover for you, ya know.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis, what was that?Phyllis are you dreaming, or-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [laughing] I did enjoy grinding your beans, son.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yeah, we really did peel your grapes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is hilarious, but we're gonna stop with all-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Shuckin' your peas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shuckin' the peas. You should go back to the first part, though. You are gonna cover for me?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Of course we are, Jimmy. We love you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, thank you. [hugging both] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you're an artist, you have to be okay with the idea that you can't please everybody all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: You paint very bad-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut up, Hide! I mean, do you think Kevin cares what people think about him- or Creed or Meredith? Oh my gosh, these are my role models now. You know what? I'm okay with that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where does gayness come from? And how is it transmitted?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That is- that is a loaded question.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My pastor said it can come from breast feeding.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He said that?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, he didn't fight me hard on it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I- I don't know if there's truth to- to, uh, to that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is it called when two men intertwine their penises like the snakes on the medic-alert bracelet?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh... uh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is it called red-vining?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is it called red-vining?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We heard it was called red-vining.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: People red vine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where are gay mens' vaginas?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: They don't have vaginas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No. They're just regular men.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When two gay men have sex, how do they know whose penis will open up to accept the other person's penis?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh... wow....
